page.title: 01Mathry
page.content: This are of north Pemrokeshire is predominantly agricultural with the attractive village of Mathy just mostly in the block. Although apparently an unpopulated are there ae many houses in the area and farms. The area is bounded to the north by the coast. The Pembbrokeshire coast path runs through Abercastle, an attractive small fishing port. used by yachts also in the summer. The main road (A487 St Davids Fishguard) runs to the South of the block. There is a caravan site near Trefin to the west and bed and breakfast is a popular way of augmenting income.
